abstracts.cdata!:
The project will consist of: (i) a
            secondary oil recovery program in the middle Magdalena
            Valley (Casabe field) which will enable recovery of about 70
            million barrels of oil, reaching a peak production of 20,000
            barrels per day in 1988. It will also include; (ii) field
            development under association contracts between ECOPETROL
            and private oil companies, with a peak production of 16,500
            barrels per day in 1988. ECOPETROL will also participate in
            this development, paying 50% of the cost of development. The
            project will further provide; (iii) a 290 km pipeline to
            move Occidental Association crude from Cano Limon in the
            LLanos across the Andes mountains to Rio Zulia where it will
            enter existing westward-bound pipelines. Finally, the
            project will provide funds for; (iv) technical assistance
            and studies.
